All applicants must complete and submit a Financial and Credentials Information Form to support their application. Applications submitted without a complete Financial Credentials Information Form will not be assessed by the department.

Please, note the information identified through the Financial Viability and Credentials assessment will be used to verify your entityâ€™s financial state and its capacity to meet upfront cost of recruiting seasonal workers.

Please complete the form and upload it below, along with all required attachments specified in the Financial and Credentials Information Form.

Application Process

To participate in the Seasonal Worker Programme an Entity must successfully complete a three-step application process:
  1. Complete this application form and submit it via SWP Online and submit to the Department.
  2. Successful applicants will be granted provisional approval as an Approved Employer. Entities will need to apply to become a Temporary Activities Sponsor through the Department of Home Affairs in order to be able to sponsor workers from participating countries to come to Australia. The Entity has three months to become a Temporary Activities Sponsor or the Department may revoke its provisional approval and the Entity will need to submit a new application if it remains interested in becoming an Approved Employer.
  3. If approved as a Temporary Activities Sponsor, the Entity will be offered a Deed of Agreement to become an Approved employer under the SWP. After the Deed is executed, the Entity may be able to employ seasonal workers under the SWP, in accordance with obligations imposed under the Deed of Agreement and Temporary Activities Sponsorship.

Instructions

Please ensure you complete all parts of the application form. Any answers found to be false, misleading or inaccurate will result in rejection of the application and may result in the termination of any future Deeds of Agreement entered into by the parties.

Please state your answers clearly and provide detailed information when lodging your application. Should you need further information please contact the Department via email: SWPapplications@dese.gov.au or call (02) 6240 5234.

Application processing timeframe

Applicants should allow about five to six months from lodging an application to when they can start recruiting seasonal workers, if their application is successful. The total processing time for step 1 is approximately 12 weeks and steps 2-3 take about 4-6 weeks.

Once these steps are completed, all Approved Employers will need to complete an induction process before they submit a recruitment application to the Department for approval. The recruitment application includes a Welfare and Wellbeing Plan, Accommodation Plan, Labour Market Testing, Recruitment Details and an Offer of Employment letter. Workers cannot be recruited before a recruitment application has been approved by the department. The recruitment application approval process takes about 4-6 weeks. The total timeframe is indicative only. To ensure timely processing of an application, Entities should provide all requested information and to respond to questions fully and truthfully at the time of submission.

An Entity may only apply for Approved Employer status twice in any 12 month period from the date of submitting their first application. Should the Department require further information in order to complete their assessment, the applying Entity will be sent a Request for Information through SWP Online via email notification, outlining additional information required and stating a closing date for response. If the Entity does not respond to the Request for Information prior to the closing date, the Department will close the application.

If an Entity becomes an Approved Employer and is found to have failed to provide relevant information or, provided dishonest or misleading responses and information in their application, the Department may seek to terminate the Deed of Agreement with the Approved Employer. Termination of the Deed will impact any other agreements or sponsorship arrangements under the program.

Further information about the SWP can be found on the SWP Website.

Eligibility Criteria To become an Approved Employer, an entity must:
  1. demonstrate to the satisfaction of the Department of Education, Skills and Employment that it is an eligible business registered and operating in Australia and has an ABN.
    • Applying Entities must be incorporated in Australia or a formal partnership. Sole traders are not an eligible business.
    • They must plan to recruit seasonal workers in eligible occupations within listed industries on the Seasonal Worker Programme website.
    • Entities that use a Contractor business model must have at least five years of continuous operation.
    • They must be an â€˜Organisationâ€™ for the purposes of the Migration Regulations 1994. This is assessed by the Department of Home Affairs.
  2. satisfy integrity checks conducted by the Department of Education, Skills and Employment. It must:
    • have good immigration practices and a history of compliance with immigration legislation as assessed by the Department of Home Affairs.
    • have a history of compliance with Australian workplace relations, work health and safety legislation, and other relevant laws.

      NOTE. Directors, partners, trustees or other Relevant Persons must have a history of compliance with these laws and where there has been non-compliance, it must be disclosed in the application as well as what the entity has done to prevent such non-compliance in the future. Non-disclosure can result in the application being rejected. Labour Hire Entities and Contractors, will be required to obtain a labour hire licence as applicable.
    • be in a sound financial position. The Department of Education, Skills and Employment will conduct a financial viability assessment to determine if the applying Entity can meet the upfront costs associated with recruiting seasonal workers.
    website.
    • Applying entities (including Related entities) with previous experience as Approved Employers must have a satisfactory history of compliance with program requirements.
    • Applying entities (including Related entities) with previous experience as Host Organisations must have a satisfactory record as Host Organisations.

Please note the department will not accept applications from an entity where:
  1. the entity and/or Related entities and/or its Relevant Persons have, within the preceding five years, a history of non-compliance with relevant laws including multiple and/or serious contraventions and/or criminal offences,
  2. the entity is subject to a workplace relations or immigration investigation or prosecution, or
  3. within the preceding five years, the Department of Education, Skills and Employment terminated or did not renew a Seasonal Worker Programme Deed of Agreement (Deed) with the entity or a Related entity due to breaches of the Deed. If the department has terminated or did not renew a Deed with the entity or a Related entity for this reason more than five years ago, the entity must demonstrate how it will meet the program requirements.
Applicants must meet ALL above requirements to become an Approved Employer for the Seasonal Worker Programme.

If an Entity becomes an Approved Employer and is found to have failed to provide relevant information or, provided dishonest or misleading responses and information in their application, the Department of Education, Skills and Employment may seek to terminate the Deed with the Approved Employer. Termination of the Deed will impact any other agreements or sponsorship arrangements under the program.

If an Approved Employer breaches the program requirements, the Department of Education, Skills and Employment may seek to terminate the Deed of Agreement with the Approved Employer.

Key Terms

Contractor is an entity that delivers a service and is paid for that service (for example, for paddocks harvested).

Labour Hire entity is an entity that supplies workers to host organisations and is paid on an on-hire basis (for example, for the number of workers supplied).

Host Organisation hires seasonal workers from a labour hire Approved Employer and may host them on their property.

Related entities are entities that the directors, partners or trustees of the applying Entity currently hold the position of director or have previously held the position of director within five years prior to submission of the application.

Relevant Persons are persons who have a direct or indirect interest in the Entity or business with potential to exert influence over the management or operation of the Entity. This might include senior staff such as a Human Resources Manager or Chief Financial Officer.
What Approved Employer type is the Entity applying to become?

Please note the department in consultation with an Approved Employer can revise the cap after the first recruitment has been completed.

For contractors
Note that the department will apply a recruitment cap of between 10 and 40 for a first recruitment, at the departmentâ€™s sole discretion.

For direct employers
Note that the department will apply a recruitment cap of between 10 and 20 for a first recruitment, at the departmentâ€™s sole discretion.

For labour hire
Note that the department will apply a recruitment cap of between 10 and 40 for a first recruitment, at the departmentâ€™s sole discretion.

If you are granted Approved Employer status do you agree:

1. To genuinely test the local labour market for suitable Australian job seekers before seeking to access seasonal workers through the SWP following guidance provided by the department, including advertising available vacancies on Australian Governmentâ€™s jobsearch website.

2. To obtain and maintain approval as a Temporary Activities Sponsor (TAS) through the Department of Home Affairs.

Note: If you do not obtain approval as a Temporary Activities Sponsor within three months of being granted provisional approval of your application, the department may revoke its provisional approval and you will need to submit a new application. If you do not maintain approval as a Temporary Activities Sponsor, the department may terminate your Deed.
3. To only offer positions to seasonal workers in eligible occupations within industries listed on the SWP website.

itemList.description: SWP - assist with initial cash advance
itemList.text:
4. To offer a cash advance for reasonable initial living expenses on seasonal workersâ€™ arrival.

Note these expenses can be recouped as a reasonable authorised deduction from the seasonal workersâ€™ pay during the employment period.

5. To pay up front the full cost of return international airfares and domestic transport for all seasonal workers (you must pay the first $300 of these costs, and can recoup costs over $300 by authorised deductions from seasonal workers pay during the employment period).
6. To provide each seasonal worker a minimum of 30 hours of work per week on average for the duration of their placement.

7. To ensure the ongoing welfare and wellbeing of the seasonal workers while they are in Australia, including, but not limited to monitoring the progress, placement and well-being of seasonal workers on a regular basis.

8. To arrange accommodation for seasonal workers under the SWP:
  • that meets relevant state, territory or council regulations or legislative requirements
  • that meets the programâ€™s minimum accommodation standards
  • where the cost represents value for money and does not exceed the cost to you
Note this expense can be recouped by authorised deductions from the seasonal workerâ€™s pay during the employment period.

9. To provide weekly/fortnightly pay slips to seasonal workers under the SWP that clearly set out gross pay, net pay, itemised deductions, tax and superannuation, and to instruct each seasonal worker how to read their pay slip.

10. To ensure any deductions from seasonal workersâ€™ pay are allowable under the SWP Deed of Agreement, reasonable, have been explained to and agreed by the seasonal worker in advance and in writing.

11. To ensure that seasonal workers under the SWP meet their visa obligations. This includes ensuring the seasonal workers have and maintain adequate health insurance during the period of their stay in Australia and to assist seasonal workers to depart Australia before their visa expires.
12. To facilitate access to personal banking, a superannuation, and a Tax File Number for each seasonal worker under the SWP.
13. To facilitate the opportunity for seasonal workers under the SWP to participate in Australian Government funded eligible training while they are in Australia.

14. To ensure seasonal workers under the SWP have freedom of choice, association and movement outside of working hours, and to facilitate access to religious, recreational, shopping, health and other facilities as required.
Declaration
If you are offered a Deed of Agreement (Deed) do you agree:

1. To sign and return a copy of the Deed within 20 business days of receipt of the Deed. If the Deed is not returned within the timeframe, our offer to you to become an Approved Employer may be withdrawn.
2. To abide by all Deed requirements.
3. To engage with the Australian Government and its representatives, and with partner countriesâ€™ governments and their representatives, in a respectful manner at all times.
4. To participate in program assurance and compliance and program evaluation activities, as required by the department.

5. Where applicable, that your Deed will be subject to you obtaining and maintaining any labour hire licence(s) applicable to you in any states/territories you seek to place seasonal workers under the SWP.
Declaration

Please note all answers to the following questions will be checked and verified by the assessing bodies and taken into consideration in assessing your eligibility to become an SWP Approved Employer. Non-disclosure or any answers found to be false, misleading or inaccurate will result in rejection of your application and may result in the termination of any future Deeds of Agreement entered into by the parties.

Personal information

Personal information is information or an opinion about an individual. Personal information includes a personâ€™s name and contact details.

Personal information is protected by law, including under the Privacy Act 1988 (Privacy Act).

Sensitive information is a type of personal information and includes information about an individualâ€™s criminal record, cultural or linguistic background and political opinions.

Collection of personal information

The department collects personal information from applicants to become Approved Employers, from Approved Employers, Seasonal Worker Programme (SWP) participants and from other Commonwealth and state/territory Government agencies for the purposes of administering the SWP and related purposes, including assessing applications to become an Approved Employer, SWP deed administration and program evaluation and research.

If you do not provide some or all of the personal information requested in the application form, the department may not be able to process your application and the Entity may not be eligible to participate in the SWP.

Disclosure of personal information

The department may disclose collected personal information to others, including but not limited to:
  • Commonwealth agencies and their contracted providers, including, but not limited to:
    • the Department of Home Affairs;
    • the Fair Work Ombudsman;
    • the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade;
    • the Department of Health;
    • the Australian Taxation Office;
    • the Australian Federal Police;
    • the Australian National Audit Office; and/or
  • state or territory agencies and their respective contracted providers, including:
    • law enforcement agencies;
    • health agencies;
    • workplace health and safety agencies;
    • workers compensation agencies; and/or
  • local governments and their authorities.

The personal information provided may also be given to other parties where the person to whom the personal information relates has agreed, or where it is otherwise permitted, including where it is required or authorised by or under an Australian law or a court or tribunal order.

Privacy Policy

The departmentâ€™s Privacy Policy, including information about how an individual may access and seek correction of personal information held by the department can be found on the department's privacy page or by requesting a copy from the department at privacy@dese.gov.au.
I have read and understood the privacy statement and the department's Privacy Policy

Privacy consent and/or declaration

Collection, use and disclosure of sensitive information

Sensitive information is a type of personal information and includes information about an individualâ€™s criminal history. The department needs consent in order to collect sensitive information.

If you have provided your own personal information in this form, by submitting this form, you confirm that you have read, understood and consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal information, including sensitive information, in accordance with the above privacy consent.

If you provide another personâ€™s or other peoplesâ€™ personal information to the department, by submitting this form you confirm that the individual/s to whom the sensitive information relates has/have consented to the department collecting, using and disclosing their personal and sensitive information.

Overseas disclosure of personal information

If your application to become an Approved Employer is successful, throughout your participation in SWP the department may disclose the name and contact details of the individuals nominated by you as relevant contacts, to relevant overseas partner countries for the purposes of administering the SWP and related purposes.

The department needs consent to disclose this personal information to the overseas recipients. These overseas recipients may not have the same privacy protection obligations as Australia in relation to personal information.

By submitting this form, you confirm that you always gain consent of the relevant individuals to the overseas disclosure of their personal information prior to providing this information to the department. This means that Australian Privacy Principle 8.1, as set out in the Privacy Act, will not apply to the disclosure of the personal information provided to overseas recipients.

Privacy declaration

By submitting this form, you confirm that:
  • the individuals whose personal information have been provided in this application; and
  • any individuals whose personal information you provide to the department throughout your participation in SWP
are aware of the Privacy Consent, the departmentâ€™s Privacy Policy and advised to familiarise themselves with the content of the Privacy Consent and the departmentâ€™s Privacy Policy.
I have read and understood the consent and declaration

Disclaimer

Submission of this application form is not to be taken to be or relied upon as an offer capable of acceptance by any person or as creating any form of contractual, quasi contractual, restitutionary or promissory estoppel rights, or rights based on similar legal or equitable grounds, whether implied or otherwise.

Neither the department, nor its officers, employees, agents or advisers will be liable to any applicant or any other person on the basis of any contract or other understanding whatsoever, or in negligence, as a consequence of any matter relating or incidental to this application or an applicantâ€™s participation in this application process, including instances where:
  1. an applicant is not invited to participate in the SWP following submission of this application;
  2. the department varies the application process;
  3. the department decides to terminate the application process, not proceed to any subsequent process, or not to contract for all or any of the requirements; or
  4. the department exercises or fails to exercise any of its other rights in relation to this application process.

Participation in any stage of this application process or in relation to any matter concerning this application process will be at each applicantâ€™s sole risk, cost and expense. The department will not be responsible in any circumstance for any costs or expenses incurred by any applicant in preparing or lodging an application or in taking part in this application process or taking any action related to this application process.
